Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: j_flinn23
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a long weekend trip to Rome, staying at the First with my boyfriend. We both loved the hotel, with it's quirky art dotted around and the fantastic location... we would definitely come back again. The service in the hotel was great and the room was just what we needed for a weekend trip. Our room was fairly small however the large king size bed was a welcomed addition! The one negative I do have is that all of the deluxe rooms are adjoining and as mentioned in other reviews, you can hear everything your neighbours are doing (even if they are just talking at a normal volume). This didn't bother us too much though as we didn't spend much time in the room as we were out enjoying the sites! As a whole I would definitely recommend the hotel and would return here again!

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: J J
Reviews.Content: After reading such good reviews on this hotel, I booked it and was expecting perhaps more than I should. Very good location, modern tasteful decor and nice and clean. Big drawback is (actually this I subsequently found out, as one always do, this has been mentioned by other reviews) the room is not sound proof at all. I could clearly hear my next door neighbors having a great time laughing and chatting in the middle of the night. As a result, we have to constantly remind ourselves to speak in whisper. Next drawback is the hot water in the bath room is not that hot sometimes (sometimes it's okay). We tried to get hotel staff to fix it but they seem to think it's hot enough! Air-condition cannot go past 23 degrees, which for us was a bit cold because my hubby wasn't feeling too well and we ended up having to turn it off completely from time to time. Lastly, there's no free bottled water.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: foodgrl
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel in November 2011. The location is fantastic. The hotel is on a quiet street off Via de Ripetta, one of the three major streets that run north to south throughout the city. The hotel is nearest the Piazza del Popolo- one of the quieter piazzas in Rome, which is nice after walking through the crowds along the Via del Corso where one can find a great deal of shopping and a lot of tourists. The rooms were well appointed and have a typical amount of space for a standard room with a king size bed for any major world city. I prefer to stay in boutique hotels for the character that other hotels like the Hassler or the Four Seasons cannot provide. The First Hotel absolutely felt warmer than the business like hotels devoid of any real character. There were only a few drawbacks. The location is on a quiet street which keep the noise down, but the walls between my room and the next was a little thin- I could hear my neighbors' television most of the time. The concierge were kind and very accommodating, but I am a foodie and they didn't really know any hidden gems for finer dining. That was disappointing, but all in all the team present during my 7 days was as helpful as they could be. I would recommend this hotel to future guests of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Rome's Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: horadam1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this beautiful hotel for 4 nights, and the accommodations were lovely. Everything is new and very clean! I would like to respond to one of the reviews about no A/C. That was true. My private tour guide did tell me that Rome is very strict about air conditioning before April 1st so it is not the fault of the hotel. We did open our window which made the room comfortable. The location can not be beat. The hotel is on a little street very close to the best shopping and excellent restaurants.we were able to walk everywhere! The staff were young and professional. The service in the restaurant was outstanding, and the food was delicious. This will be my place to stay when in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: FanXi
Reviews.Content: I was just in Rome this past week with my friend. The room (art suite) was amazing. The staff was very helpful and friendly, they found opera tickets for us, recommended restaurants and a spa. I would definitely stay there again. The view from the roof was also amazing at night.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in Rome”
Reviews.Author: WinniePLondon
Reviews.Content: The First Hotel is a beautiful and well managed hotel. I have been treated like a little princess from check in to check out. The rooms are larged and well equiped, very cozy. The bed is extremely confortable. There is a great walk in closet and the bathroom is just stuning. The location is just perfect tuck up in a side street so very quiet and discreet. The staff is discreet, attentive and warm. The breakfast and dinner is really enjoyable. In the evening there is a musician in the bar so you won't feel the need to leave the hotel! I could not recommend the hotel enough !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveller60763
Reviews.Content: Left the hotel and wish I were still there. I had a great time, especially thanks to the service and location of the hotel. From the moment you walk in you feel like you're in an art museum, but done in a very delicate and non-pretentious way. Then, the very open and welcoming front desk gives the hotel a different and modern vibe to other 5 star hotels I've stayed at. I'd like to personally thank Alex at the front desk for his prompt and attentive service throughout our entire stay. He made us feel very welcome and was extremely polite. Also, the hotel is really well located, near city life, but tucked away in a quaint side street. Overall, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Like coming home”
Reviews.Author: ChristopherTK
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter the doors at this hotel you feel like a royal. The warm welcome in the reception and the following guide up to the marvelous room is just breathtaking. We had a junior suite for three nights, and the room was one of the best we have ever been staying at. The facilities was good, the service was EXCELLENT! E However, the breakfast was not the most exciting I've seen, and with a price of €30 per person it's rather expensive and not as valuable as I was hoping for.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly luxury”
Reviews.Author: TheoFly
Reviews.Content: I'm not a regular in 5 stars hotels but I can definitely appreciate quality services and aesthetics. The first luxury art hotel in Rome is what I would call a smooth as silk and cool luxury. Saying that, I mean that there was never a moment that we felt that our needs or wishes wouldn't be met. Miriam was our welcoming receptionist and honestly I felt like somebody was offering me his own residence for a couple of days. The personel there has a way to make you feel comfortable. There is nothing snoby about this hotel. Fresh , young people are willing to fix you a drink, show you to your room, invite your for breakfast and are always there when you need them. We had arranged our airport transfer with the service offered by the hotel and although it could be in a more competitive price (comparing to other freelance transfer providers' prices) I must admit that the hotel's smoothness was extended straight up to the airport' s threshold. From the moment we left the baggage reclaim area we forgot about our luggage just to find it again in the walking closet of our room after half an hour. At this point I should mention that we were offered a room upgrade which was more than a pleasant surprise. I'm not gonna stay in the room amenities and decoration. What you see in the officially published photos is exactly what you get. I'm gonna stay though in the flexibility of the management in optimising accomodation when availability allows it. Two Weeks ago, we asked for a late check out and our flight's arrival time implied an early check in. Management upgraded our room in order to ensure that we get both and that's a five stars attitude. Regarding the aesthetics it was definitely of my liking. Minimal, poparty with proper touches of roman-mediterranean elements and enough cosinessin the rooms. Nothing overloaded, no funny gold architraves, no red carpets nothing out of date and old -fashioned. My congrats to the architectural design group (I'm an architect myself) Last but not least, catering was of the same attitude and freshness. We tried the valentine's truffle menu although that was not the reason of our travel and it was worth every penny. My palette would agree with me. Bar service was nice, eager to talk, suggest and make you feel like drinking in your sofa with friends without loosing its loungy touch. Only thing I would like to see improved would be a more robust personel presence both in the bar and the breakfast time restaurant. Both guys where genuinely interested and flamiliarly friendly but it felt like they were comissioned with a bunch of other tasks that kept them away of your sight for several intervals. Closing I wish breakfast buffet was more corresponidng to the rest of the hotel in terms of inspiration. Everything as beautiful and tasty but it missed the element of imagination. All in all. Definitely stay there cause we will definitely get back too

Reviews.Title: “50th Birthday at The First”
Reviews.Author: ColinMcLean120262
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights celebrating my 50th birthday at this Fantastic hotel, the hotel upgraded us to a suite and also added breakfast as a special treat for my birthday. The location of this hotel is great, 5 mins from the nearest tube station/main shopping district and 10 mins to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. The room was spacious, spotless and very trendy, throughout the hotel the theme is very modern and on par with other 5 star hotels we have been fortunate to stay in over the years. I must say a very special thank you to all the excellent staff who made our trip very special. If you are looking for a modern boutique hotel in the centre of Rome, this is the place to stay !! Colin & Kim McLean

Reviews.Title: “more than a dream”
Reviews.Author: lsheizaf
Reviews.Content: It was a dream week. The hotel is designed so well, every point is carefully. Everything was clean and cozy. Warm and dedicated staff gives personal attention 24 hours a day, for a moment we forgot that we were without our family ... Professional and responsible service, all staff speak excellent English. The hotel is close to everything, especially the important street - Corsso shopping district. Do not miss a meal at the hotel because it turns out that the chef is an artist as well and as far as the meal in the hotel was the best we eat in Rome. I already miss the hotel. have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay, definitely worth a visit.”
Reviews.Author: david_k001
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay @ The First. The room was incredibly nice and the staff was helpful and friendly. We had a couple of hiccups in the beginning, but the staff was quick to respond and I can't say enough good things about the people at the reception desk -- especially Tatiana. She's gracious, friendly, funny and truly customer service oriented. I found the location convenient to everything (tourist attractions, shopping, restaurants). The hotel room was well designed with attention to detail (built-in bookshelves, tasteful contemporary/transitional decor that was well planned, seductive lighting, natural stone baths, deep soaking tub with air jets (depending on the room you book), etc.). The outdoor rooftop is very attractively put together and provides an excellent panoramic view of Rome (especially for viewing New Year's eve fireworks). Special thanks to the Deputy General Manager, Cinzia, for inviting us to enjoy a champagne toast on the roof at the stroke of midnight. It was amazing. If you're looking for a small, intimate, boutique hotel, I'd definitely recommend The First.

Reviews.Title: “PROS: Super location, brand new, nice furnishing CONTRA: small”
Reviews.Author: Canneto79
Reviews.Content: PROS: (1) super location: ideal middle point from everything interesting in rome... you cannot beat the location of this hotel (2) brand new hotel with luxury furnishing: nice brand new modern luxury furnishing (nice marble everywhere), high tech rooms (wifi available and solid, led HD TVs), comfortable beds, super nice bathrooms, (3) silence: on a secondary street and with internal gardens ... so no or very little outside noise... sound insulated rooms (sound adsorbing material on the rooms walls)... unfortunately some noise from other people in the hotel during our stay but incidental and not annoying CONTRAS: instead of CONTRAS, I prefer to call them BUTs in this case.... (1) SMALL!! with all the consequences of it.... limited personnel for service, no additional services that u expect from a 5 stars hotel (no pool, no amenities of large hotels, ...), nice breakfast but being small limited in choice, there is a bar but being so small.. no people.... ... if u like intimate hotels, SMALL can be an advantage.. (2) small rooms!!!: i m amazed they are a 5 star hotel with so tiny rooms... BUT you r in rome and the furnishing is super nice... (3) new BUT with some downwards of it: heating system still to be finetuned (room at 25 celsius with the heater OFF and in the middle of the winter!!), ..... (4) third party private garage in front of the hotel ..super... BUT... 45eu per day.. and... cash only.... (5) slighlty expensive... BUT u r in rome ...get used to it...

Reviews.Title: “An easy name to remember in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Alex C
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance to your favourite shops, tourist spots, and of course great eats, this hotel is a gem in Rome. We arrived in our rented Audi and already the car rental guy was there ready to pick up the return, so entering the lobby of this artsy hotel was a double blessing for the tired eyes. Greeted by an unusual stone cow with telephones sitting on top immediately fired the arty thoughts for me. The staff were very welcoming, buzzing around, and dealt with our check-in easily. The room was beautifully appointed, though a bit tight if you have big luggage like the both of us. A little balcony added an nice outdoor feel to a very elegant room. Two bookcases adorned left and right of the king bed we asked for. There was a nice rooftop bar that we enjoyed one last moonlit starry night, where you can easily see the Vatican from. Being right in the heart of the bustle of Rome, we did not try any of the F&B outlets in the hotel though, but it is a hotel we can easily return to.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: lucas f
Reviews.Content: This hotel is called the first, and it is true is just the first, number one, good choice to set up in a real art gallery, the inside is very elegant, beautiful their restaurant, where we ate really well, is not very economical as a hotel but if you want the best these is money really well spent, thanks to the concierge for having recommended then Porto di Ripetta restaurant good advice!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: AEO36
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for four nights and highly recommend the hotel. In particular, the staff went well above and beyond -- from the moment we walked in, they couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. We loved the in-room check-in, the quality of the bed and linens, the antipasti and drinks at the bar, the large bathroom in the room, the fantastic roof deck with lovely views, the strong and dependable wifi, and well, just about everything else. I'm generally one to find fault, but I'd be hard pressed to complain about anything. And above all else, the staff were just wonderful. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated boutique hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: Vilhjálmur Þ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the First Hotel for three nights for a Rome city trip. The hotel is very well located in a quiet side street that is close to Via del Corso and Piazza del Popolo. It is new and stylish with works of contemporary art displayed in the public areas. A beautiful rooftop bar and restaurant offers nice views of the city and is great for chilling as dusk sets in after a day of sightseeing. We stayed in a regular room which was fairly small but very comfortable and well appointed. There is no spa or gym at the hotel yet but we were told this is coming soon. A problem with WiFi at our floor was expediously corrected, and service was attentive and personal. The only drawback was that the breakfast buffet was rather limited as is often the case in smaller boutique hotels. I definitely recommend this hotel for its style, ambiance, service and location, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb...but sort the noise in the room next door”
Reviews.Author: Manannin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the first art hotel in Rome for three nights in mid-September to celebrate my birthday. The Hotel is very well positioned in the heart of Rome close to the Piazza Del Popolo. We were welcomed warmly at reception and escorted to our room, where we received explanation of the working of the air-con and very high-tech shower, etc, by a charming receptionist and our bags were delivered by an equally friendly staff member a few moments later. Whilst not especially large, our room was beautifully furnished, with an extremely comfortable bed and a very stylish bathroom; though, along with two basins and lavatory and a bidet, it included only a shower - I am a fan of soaking in the bath and always find it slightly disappointing not to have one available. The decor and artwork in the hotel are very attractive and the furnishings of the ground floor bar are stylish in the extreme. The pièce de résistance for us was the superb rooftop bar/restaurant. We dined there on one of our evenings in Rome and the meal was very good, rather than exceptional. However, in the wonderful warm September evening weather, both dining and enjoying cocktails on the rooftop bar was a total pleasure. The view was pretty spectacular as well. The one observation of concern that I would make, which I notice has been echoed by another recent reviewer, is the extent to which sounds from the adjacent room very easily found their way to ours via, seemingly, the connecting door. Fortunately, we were only disturbed in this way on a couple of mornings shortly before we were due to get out of bed anyway, but it was extremely surprising the extent to which there was limited - indeed virtually no - soundproofing between the rooms. Music was being played in the room next door, clearly not at an excessive volume, but it was as clear as if it were alongside our bed. The same was true of human voices/conversation. Were I to stay in this hotel again, which I would be prepared to do, I would insist on a room that did not have a connecting door to the adjacent one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: mle07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 4 nights in Rome at this hotel and it was amazing. The staff were incredibly helpful without being overbearing. The location is perfect - close to everything yet quiet. There is a gorgeous rooftop bar with spectacular views. They helped me to plan a surprise for my husband's birthday and offered us a complimentary bottle of prosecco in the rooftop terrace at sunset. It was perfect. The rooms were incredibly comfortable (and they gave us an upgrade on arrival), and while the design of the hotel is modern and perhaps a bit stark, the rooms are warm and comfortable with very nice contemporary bathrooms. (If I had one negative comment, it is that the lighting in the shower is a little dim). The hotel had all of the amenities, but was not "gilded" like so many hotels in Rome. We stayed at the Hassler last year, which was nice, but after staying at The First Luxury Art Hotel, and I would not go back there. This is a perfect hotel for guests who are interested in nightlife, for couples and for business travelers. There is free wifi, a great breakfast and a lovely restaurant (though we did not have dinner there). I cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome, Stayed Friday to Monday.The location of the hotel couldn't be better, everything was walking distance away.The hotel is beautiful, very modern and immaculate.The reception staff are friendly and very accommodating.We were shown to our delux room which was small but beaufifully furnished with a large luxury bathroom.The main problem was that the delux rooms have adjoining doors to the adjacent rooms(I guess designed to accommodate families), you could here the people in the next door room talking which was not what we were expecting.We were visiting Rome for my fortieth Birthday and were having a break from our two young children so wanted complete privacy.We advised the hotel that we were not happy with the room and were shown various other options. We settled on moving to one of the jaccuzzi suites and agreed to pay an additional fee for the upgrade(we were charged a nominal fee and the hotel also agreed to include breakfast which was more than acceptable).The hotel dealt with what was an awkward situation exceptionally,they really went out of their way to ensure we were happy.The suite was the best I have stayed in, large bathroom,trendy immaculate living room with hidden plasma tv(disguised as wall mounted mirror),beautiful large bedroom with sumptious bedding and further plasma tv,large walk in wardrobe and finally the fantastic and very private terrace with hot tub.The hotel also has a fantastic roof terrace restaurant/bar with magnificent views of rome.The food was great although the menu was'nt extensive enough and the service was just ok(we found the service was the same at every restaurant we went to so I guess this is just the Rome way!).The hotel left a bottle of champagne on the terrace on our first night and decorated our room and the terrace with rose petals and candles along with another bottle of champagne on the Saturday night,Fantastic.We had one long wait for room service but apart from this I can not say enough good things about the hotel. I would advise anyone thinking of booking to call the hotel direct to discuss which rooms are available as some rooms had shower only and others had bath only. We would definately visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed at in Rome....”
Reviews.Author: WarrenSCohn
Reviews.Content: They saved our trip and allowed it to remain amazing!! It was our last weekend in Rome after a 2 week European jaunt and I had booked a suite at another hotel that I hadn't stayed at before ( we wanted to try something new)...it turned out disastrous. Moldy shower, hair on sheets and towels, 30yr mattress and on and on. We tried to change rooms but that hotel was very unaccomodating. Though we prepaid on expedia there, we weren't going to let this dampen the best trip ever. I walked outside, got on my iphone and booked us a jnr suite at the first luxury art hotel and hopped in a cab. it was like taking an express elevator from down below to the gates of heaven. three people greeted us out front, gave us a tour of the hotel and a choice of junior suite rooms to pick from and found ourselves in one of the best appointed hotel rooms I've been in. Having been to Rome several times, I will no longer stay anywhere else. It's a fairly brand-new hotel, but rest assured their rooms, service and attentive staff will make your trip memorable. Plus they have the most gorgeous views from the rooftop deck. They are not cheap, but VERY WORTH EVER EURO!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Beyond words. Hidden pearl of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Hitcher13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely the best of the best. Brand new. Clean. Helpful staff. Everything you wish for on your holiday. Do not hesitate and book a room!!! The view form the top floor is spectacular. There is nothing bad that I can say about this great hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: The First Luxury Art Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via del Vantaggio 14, 00186 Rome, Italy
